creator: incze@mail.matav.hu
text:
Something is really broken (at least in my tomcat setup). The scenario
is as follows:

Players:

machine 1: redhat 6.2, IBM JDK 1.3, tomcat 3.3m1, netscape 4.76
machine2: WIN NT 4.0, explorer 5.5

Install tomcat 3.3.1 (I tryed both the tarball and the RPMs provided
by H. Gomez.) Start the tomcat sever. Navigate to the sun-examples->
servlet examples->sessions example 1st on machine1 then on machine2.

Yo will get something like this:

On machine1:
......................
Sessions Example

Session ID: n2rlaiq941 
Created: Thu Mar 15 23:44:32 CET 2001
Last Accessed: Thu Mar 15 23:44:32 CET 2001 

The following data is in your session:

Name of Session Attribute:  _________
Value of Session Attribute: _________

..................etc.

On machine2:
...................................
Sessions Example

Session ID: vts2a6q9d1
Created: Thu Mar 15 23:44:50 CET 2001
Last Accessed: Thu Mar 15 23:44:50 CET 2001 

The following data is in your session:

Name of Session Attribute:  _______
Value of Session Attribute: _______
........................................etc.
And now the bad news:

The secod run OVERWROTE THE 1st BROWER'S SESSION
INFORMATION. If I press simply the submit button
on machine1, I'll get:

Sessions Example

Session ID: vts2a6q9d1 
Created: Thu Mar 15 23:44:50 CET 2001
Last Accessed: Thu Mar 15 23:44:50 CET 2001 

The following data is in your session:
= 

Name of Session Attribute:  ________________
Value of Session Attribute: ________________
......................................................

Please take me seriously, My app sessions worked
right this way and I'v been poking after a bug for days,
until I reached the point to this simple test. So,
it's NOT A JOKE (altough really funny that I couldn't find
a word about this session problem on the list). In my env
this is reproducable right after the installation with
the steps described above. It seems to me that a  resource
remains on some free list even after it was allocated, so
is is reallocated to another party again.          incze
